Xmlunit would help, within the constraints of JAXP.

On Mar 28, 2009 2:56 AM, "jmc3631" <murat.knecht@...> wrote:

  Hi,

I would like to integrate validation of XML files in JUnit Tests.

It would be cool to just point to a directory of xml files, provide a schema
and then have for each schema a testcase generated, with one method for each
xml instance file.

Something like this:
- car.xsd
--- gm.xml (assertion failed: attribute missing bla bla)
--- toyota.xml (ok)
- opera.rng
--- der_ring_des_nibelungen.xml (ok)
--- la_traviata.xml (ok)

This would allow for a comprehensive and compact display of the validation,
e.g. in eclipse or on a test-server, performing daily unit tests and
producing output in a well-known fashion.

Google does not seem to help much. Does someone know of such a tool?

All the best,
Murat
